messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node replace in the Stable Video Diffusion model?
The ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node replaces the init_image conditioning for the Stable Video Diffusion image to video model with text embeds, together with a conditioning frame.
What is the recommended state of the latents input into the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node?
It is recommended to input the latents in a noisy state.
Why is the default ComfyUI noise not suitable for the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node?
The default ComfyUI noise does not create optimal results for the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node.
What alternative noise type is suggested for use with the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node?
Using other noise types, such as Power-Law Noise, helps with the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node.
What factors are preserved as possible input for the conditioning in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
Motion bucket, fps, and augmentation level are preserved as possible input for the conditioning in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
What is the behavior of the video generation process with the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node?
The video generation process with the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node needs a couple frames time to get on its feet and run.
How does maxing out EDM sigma affect the images generated with ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
Maxing out EDM sigma helps get more color into the image when using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
What is the recommended CFG guidance spread for the VideoLinearCFGGuidance feature in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
A small CFG guidance spread of around 2 (e.g. min_cfg 18 & sampler cfg 20) is recommended for the VideoLinearCFGGuidance feature in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid to help with image quality consistency.
